p: Uptake of P varied significantly ( p ≤ 0.01) among cultivars ( Table 4). The cultivar P 3522 accumulated highest amounts of P in grain followed by P3396. Lowest P accumulation in maize grain was recorded in Rajkumar. The NPK application exerted significant influence on P uptake in maize grain. Data presented in Table 4 also showed increasing trend in P uptake with successive increase in NPK levels up to 125% RDF and it was declined with further increase in NPK level (up to 150% RDF). It is also interesting to note that N omission had far greater impact on P uptake by hybrid maize cultivars, rather than P and K omission. Year × cultivar × levels of NPK interactions exerted significant ( p ≤ 0.01) effect on grain P uptake. Among all the tested hybrids, irrespective of cropping season, P 3522 accumulated maximum grain P when fertilized with 125% RDF while P 3522 accumulated more grain P during year 1.
